intro: Stypandra scabra, commonly known as the rough stypandra, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Stypandra scabra is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathland and woodland habitats. It is an important component of the local flora and is valued for its ornamental and ecological significance.
